intro: Euphorbia mahafalensis var. mahafalensis, commonly known as the Mahafal spurge, is a succulent plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically green with a waxy coating. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by colorful bracts, giving it a striking appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
